name: Akamai Network Lists
description: The Network Lists API allows you to manage a common set of lists for use in various Akamai security products such as Kona Site Defender, Web App Protector, and Bot Manager.

base_url.description: Base URL for the API. This URL is given to you when you setup the API Client in the Akamai Control Center. e.g. https://akaa-WWWWWWWWWWWW.luna.akamaiapis.net

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration.

actions.verbose: List all network lists available for an authenticated user who belongs to a group, optionally filtered by listType or based on a search string. Results appear within the networkLists array, which might be empty if no network lists are available to the client.

search.description: Only list items that match the specified substring in any network list’s name or list of items.

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list’s deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. (Default: false)

includeelements.description: If enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. (Default: false)

actions.description: Gets a network list’s most recent syncPoint version.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for each network list. Comma seperate list allowed.

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list’s deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. (Default: false)

includeelements.description: If enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. (Default: false)

name.description: Name for the new network list.

type.description: Type of the new network list.

description.description: Description of the new network list.

list.description: IP(s) for the new network list. Comma seperate list allowed.

actions.description: Removes a network list. You can only remove network lists that never activated. To deactivate a list, you can empty out its list of elements.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

actions.description: Update the network list items and properties. Allows you to set the name, description and set of network list items to the resource. The current state of the list will be replaced with the properties and items you provide. The type cannot be changed.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for each network list.

name.description: Update or change the name of the network list.

description.description: Update or change the description of the network list.

actions.description: Adds the specified element(s) to a list. If the network list’s type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

elements.description: Element(s) to add to the network list. Comma seperate list allowed.

actions.description: Remove the specified element(s) to a list. If the network list’s type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

elements.description: Element(s) to add to the network list. Comma seperate list allowed.

actions.description: Activate the most recent syncPoint version of a network list in either the STAGING or PRODUCTION environment.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

environment.description: Environment to activate the network to. (Default: STAGING)

comments.description: Comments to add to the network.

notification.description: Notification Recipients for the network list. Comma seperate list allowed.

actions.description: Shows a network list’s activation status on either the STAGING or PRODUCTION environment.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

environment.description: Environment to activate the network to. (Default: STAGING)

actions.description: Gets a version of a network list in its state when activated, with each version identified by its syncPoint value. You can only get syncPoint versions that have been activated.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.

syncpoint.description: The network list version for which to retrieve the snapshot.

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list’s deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. (Default: false)

actions.description: Provides detailed status for a given activation, including progress on fast activation and other audit information, in addition to information ordinarily available from the Get activation status operation.

activationid.description: Unique identifier for the network list.
